intro: Devauxia exserta, commonly known as the slender devauxia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its climbing habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in racemes, which are often overlooked due to their modest appearance. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are adapted for dispersal by wind, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat.
